newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Caltex no comment on selldown talk.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Caltex no comment on selldown talk.

text.p: Petroleum retailer Caltex Australia Ltd said it had no comment on market reports that its major shareholder Texas-based Caltex Petroleum Corp plans to sell down its stake to 51 percent from the current 75 percent.
"I know nothing about it, I have seen nothing from the States from Caltex," a spokesman for Caltex told Reuters.
The spokesman said the company might issue a statement to the Australian Stock Exchange in regard to the market rumours.
Caltex Petroleum is 50 percent owned each by Texaco Inc and Chevron Corp.
Caltex Australian has a 50 perent stake in Australia's largest petroleum refiner and retailer Ampol Petroleum Pty Ltd, which it jointly owns with Pioneer International Ltd.
At 3.10 p.m. (0510 GMT), Caltex shares were 10 cents or 1.89 percent lower at A$5.20 in an overall stronger market.
